questions.question: What is the definition of central processing unit (CPU)?
options: a user interface for managing system resources
a high-speed storage device external to the CPU
a component in a computer system that processes data and instructions
software used to translate high-level code
questions.answer: a component in a computer system that processes data and instructions

questions.question: In smaller electronic systems like washing machines or traffic lights, what component performs similar functions to a CPU?
options: Control unit
Microprocessor
Register
System clock
questions.answer: Microprocessor

questions.question: What is the definition of microprocessor?
options: a device used to cool down the CPU
software used to translate high-level code
a security system protecting against malware
an integrated circuit that is able to perform many of the functions of a CPU
questions.answer: an integrated circuit that is able to perform many of the functions of a CPU

questions.question: The three key parts of the CPU are the control unit (CU), the arithmetic and logic unit (ALU), and ______.
questions.answer: registers

questions.question: The von Neumann architecture introduced which key concept in the 1940s?
options: The concept of multiple processors working together
The concept of the stored program
The concept of wireless data transmission
The concept of graphical user interfaces
questions.answer: The concept of the stored program

questions.question: Match each CPU component with its correct function:

pairs.Memory Address Register (MAR): Holds the address of the data or instruction to be located in RAM
pairs.Memory Data Register (MDR): Holds the data or instruction that are fetched from RAM
pairs.Current Instruction Register (CIR): Stores the current instruction being decoded and executed
pairs.Accumulator (ACC): Stores the result of any interim calculations

questions.question: The control bus is always unidirectional.
questions.answer: False

questions.question: What is the definition of instruction set?
options: a security system protecting against malware
a user interface for managing system resources
a set of commands that can be processed by a certain CPU
a high-speed storage device external to the CPU
questions.answer: a set of commands that can be processed by a certain CPU

questions.question: The ______ cycle is the process through which data and instructions are processed, and after fetching an instruction, the PC is ______ by 1.
questions.answer: fetch-decode-execute (FDE), incremented

questions.question: The system clock synchronises component operations using control signals.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: Clock speed, measured in gigahertz, determines:
options: Number of cores in the CPU
Cache size available
How many fetch-decode-execute cycles can be performed per second
Instruction set complexity
questions.answer: How many fetch-decode-execute cycles can be performed per second

questions.question: What is a quad core CPU?
options: a device used to cool down the CPU
a CPU containing four cores that can process four instructions simultaneously
a user interface for managing system resources
a high-speed storage device external to the CPU
questions.answer: a CPU containing four cores that can process four instructions simultaneously

questions.question: What is cache in relation to CPU performance?
options: External storage connected to the motherboard
High-speed memory inside the CPU that stores frequently used data and instructions
A cooling system for the processor
A backup power supply for the CPU
questions.answer: High-speed memory inside the CPU that stores frequently used data and instructions

questions.question: The three main factors affecting CPU performance are clock speed, number of cores, and size of ______.
questions.answer: cache

questions.question: An instruction set consists of what type of commands?
options: High-level programming language commands
Low-level machine code commands
Natural language commands
Graphical interface commands
questions.answer: Low-level machine code commands

questions.question: Match each component with its definition:

pairs.Opcode: Part of a machine code instruction that identifies what action the CPU has to perform
pairs.Operand: Part of a machine code instruction that identifies what data is to be used

questions.question: A machine code instruction consists of an ______ (identifies the action) and an ______ (identifies the data/location).
questions.answer: opcode, operand

questions.question: What is the function of an opcode in machine code?
options: part of the CPU that stores address
a keyword used by programmers
part of a machine code instruction that identifies what action the CPU has to perform
the instruction used to end a program
questions.answer: part of a machine code instruction that identifies what action the CPU has to perform

questions.question: What is the role of a compiler in a computer system?
options: executes all instructions in RAM
controls program flow
translates high-level code into low-level machine instructions
runs without translation
questions.answer: translates high-level code into low-level machine instructions

questions.question: What is the primary characteristic of an embedded system?
options: It can be easily reprogrammed for multiple functions
It is a computer system built into a larger device to perform one specific, dedicated function
It requires frequent software updates to operate
It only works with external computer connections
questions.answer: It is a computer system built into a larger device to perform one specific, dedicated function

questions.question: Most embedded systems are not easy to reprogram.
questions.answer: True

questions.question: SoC stands for __________, which combines everything into a single integrated system.
questions.answer: System on Chip

questions.question: What type of input/output might an embedded system in a vending machine use?
options: Inputs: barcode reader; Outputs: screen
Inputs: coin sensors; Outputs: motors or actuators
Inputs: internet router; Outputs: camera
Inputs: stylus; Outputs: touchscreen
questions.answer: Inputs: coin sensors; Outputs: motors or actuators

questions.question: Match the embedded system component to its description:

pairs.Microcontroller: CPU, RAM, ROM on one chip

questions.question: Embedded systems are designed to perform a single ______ function.
questions.answer: dedicated
